word: MOSES AND ELIJAH.\97Moses upon the mount of transfiguration was a witness to Christ\92s victory over sin and death. He represented those who shall come from the grave at the resurrection of the just. Elijah, who had been translated to heaven without seeing death, represented those who will be living upon the earth at Christ\92s second coming, and who will be \93changed, in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump;\94 when \93this mortal must put on immortality,\94 and \93this corruptible must put on incorruption.\94 1 Corinthians 15:51-53. Jesus was clothed with the light of heaven, as He will appear when He shall come \93the second time without sin unto salvation.\94 For He will come \93in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.\94 Hebrews 9:28; Mark 8:38.
